availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on June 16, 1808 in Kentucky. Farmer. Native of Kentucky. Moved to Missouri in 1837. He subsequently moved back to farm in Shelby County. Married to Hannah Middleton. Children included Oliver A., James M., and Ann E. Died on January 3, 1898 in Lexington when he was struck by a train.

bibl.p: Walter Williams, History of Northwest Missouri Vol. 2 (Chicago: Lewis Publishing Co., 1915), 702-704; "Find A Grave Index," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QVKQ-JJ9H : 13 December 2015), Jacob E. Sandusky, 1898; Burial, Smithfield, Henry, Kentucky, United States of America, Smithfield Cemetery; citing record ID 32833911, Find a Grave, http://www.findagrave.com.
